thread.title: Biographies of Women in History: A to Z
thread.title_full: Biographies of Women in History: A to Z

title: Biographies of Women in History: A to Z
text: Tenley Albright : figure skater, surgeon Louisa May Alcott : writer, author of Little Women and other works Francesca Alexander : folklorist, illustrator, author, philanthropist; collected folk songs Florence Ellinwood Allen : many "firsts" as a female judge Isabel Allende : novelist, writer, journalist; known for magic realism in her novels Amalasuntha : ruler of the Ostrogoths, first as regent for her son Amina, Queen of Zazzua : warrior queen who extended the territory of her people Andal : Alvar saint, Tamil devotional poet Elizabeth Garrett Anderson : first woman physician in Great Britain Marian Anderson : contralto, first black performer at the Metropolitan Opera Regina M. Anderson : Harlem Renaissance figure, librarian, playwright Margaret of Anjou : Queen Consort of Henry VI of England, figure in the Wars of the Roses and the Hundred Years' War Anna of Kiev : married to Vladimir I "the Great" of Kiev, Christianizer of Russia Anne Boleyn : wife of King Henry VIII of England Anna Comnena : Byzantine princess, first woman known to write a history Anne Neville : wife of Richard III of England, political pawn in the Wars of the Roses Anne of Cleves : wife of King Henry VIII of England (divorced) Anne of Hanover : Princess Royal (Great Britain) and Princess of Orange Anne of York : sister of British kings Richard III and Edward IV Andromache : mythical wife of a Trojan prince Andromeda : Greek princess of legend Susan B. Anthony : key woman suffrage spokesperson in the 19th century Marie Antoinette : queen consort of Louis XVI, figure in French Revolution history Virginia Apgar : physician, developed the Apgar Newborn Scoring System Eleanor of Aquitaine : ruler in her own right of Aquitaine; queen consort in France and then in England, queen mother in England Diane Arbus : documentary photographer and educator Elizabeth Arden : founder, owner and operator of a cosmetics and beauty corporation Artemisia (5th century B.C.E.) : warrior queen who fought with Xerxes at Salamis Anne Arundell : Baroness Baltimore, for whom a county in Maryland USA is named Nancy Astor : first woman to take a seat in the British House of Commons Anna Atkins : botanist and photographer Augusta (title) : a title used in the Roman empire Jane Austen : popular Romantic novelist Anne Ayres : founder of the first Episcopalian religious order for women More women's history biographies, by name:
